trans-unit.source: Azure SQL elastic database pool reference
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL elastic database pool reference

trans-unit.source: This reference provides links and details to elastic database pool articles and programmability information.
trans-unit.target: This reference provides links and details to elastic database pool articles and programmability information.

trans-unit.source: For SaaS developers who have tens, hundreds, or even thousands of databases, an elastic database pool simplifies the process of creating, maintaining, and managing both performance and cost across the entire group of databases.
trans-unit.target: For SaaS developers who have tens, hundreds, or even thousands of databases, an elastic database pool simplifies the process of creating, maintaining, and managing both performance and cost across the entire group of databases.

trans-unit.source: This reference provides links and details to elastic database pool articles and programmability information.
trans-unit.target: This reference provides links and details to elastic database pool articles and programmability information.

trans-unit.source: An elastic database pool is a collection of elastic database throughput units (eDTUs), and storage (GBs) that are shared by multiple databases.
trans-unit.target: An elastic database pool is a collection of elastic database throughput units (eDTUs), and storage (GBs) that are shared by multiple databases.

trans-unit.source: Elastic databases can be added to, and removed from the pool at any time.
trans-unit.target: Elastic databases can be added to, and removed from the pool at any time.

trans-unit.source: Elastic databases in the pool utilize only the resources they require from the pool freeing up available resources for only the active databases that need them.
trans-unit.target: Elastic databases in the pool utilize only the resources they require from the pool freeing up available resources for only the active databases that need them.

trans-unit.source: For assistance in determining if your databases would benefit in an elastic database pool, see <linkText>Price and performance considerations for an elastic database pool</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For assistance in determining if your databases would benefit in an elastic database pool, see <linkText>Price and performance considerations for an elastic database pool</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Elastic database pools are only available in Azure SQL Database V12 servers.
trans-unit.target: Elastic database pools are only available in Azure SQL Database V12 servers.

trans-unit.source: Creating and managing elastic database pools is supported using the <linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title>, PowerShell, and a .NET Client Library (wrapper for REST APIs) for Azure Resource Manager only; the <linkText>portal</linkText><title></title> and service management commands are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Creating and managing elastic database pools is supported using the <linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title>, PowerShell, and a .NET Client Library (wrapper for REST APIs) for Azure Resource Manager only; the <linkText>portal</linkText><title></title> and service management commands are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, creating new elastic databases, and moving existing databases in and out of elastic database pools is supported using Transact-SQL.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, creating new elastic databases, and moving existing databases in and out of elastic database pools is supported using Transact-SQL.

trans-unit.source: Each pool has a maximum number of databases and pool eDTUs:
trans-unit.target: Each pool has a maximum number of databases and pool eDTUs:

trans-unit.source: | Service tier | Max databases per pool* | Max eDTUs per pool* | | :-- | :-- | :-- | | Basic | 200 | 1200 | | Standard | 200 | 1200 | | Premium | 50 | 1500 |
trans-unit.target: | Service tier | Max databases per pool* | Max eDTUs per pool* | | :-- | :-- | :-- | | Basic | 200 | 1200 | | Standard | 200 | 1200 | | Premium | 50 | 1500 |

trans-unit.source: **The current limits for the number of databases per pool and number of pool eDTUs is expected to increase.*
trans-unit.target: **The current limits for the number of databases per pool and number of pool eDTUs is expected to increase.*

trans-unit.source: An elastic database pool is an Azure Resource Manager resource of type “ElasticPool” in the Microsoft Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: An elastic database pool is an Azure Resource Manager resource of type “ElasticPool” in the Microsoft Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: namespace: Microsoft.Sql/ElasticPool
trans-unit.target: namespace: Microsoft.Sql/ElasticPool

trans-unit.source: management-endpoint for REST API calls (Resource Manager): https://management.azure.com
trans-unit.target: management-endpoint for REST API calls (Resource Manager): https://management.azure.com

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: creationDate
trans-unit.target: creationDate

trans-unit.source: Date the pool is created.
trans-unit.target: Date the pool is created.

trans-unit.source: databaseDtuMax
trans-unit.target: databaseDtuMax

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of eDTUs that a single database in the pool may use.
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of eDTUs that a single database in the pool may use.

trans-unit.source: The database eDTU max is not a resource guarantee.
trans-unit.target: The database eDTU max is not a resource guarantee.

trans-unit.source: The eDTU max applies to all databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The eDTU max applies to all databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: databaseDtuMin
trans-unit.target: databaseDtuMin

trans-unit.source: Minimum number of eDTUs that a single database in the pool is guaranteed.
trans-unit.target: Minimum number of eDTUs that a single database in the pool is guaranteed.

trans-unit.source: The database eDTU min may be set to 0.
trans-unit.target: The database eDTU min may be set to 0.

trans-unit.source: The eDTU min applies to all databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The eDTU min applies to all databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: Note that the product of the number of databases in the pool and the database eDTU min cannot exceed the eDTUs of the pool itself.
trans-unit.target: Note that the product of the number of databases in the pool and the database eDTU min cannot exceed the eDTUs of the pool itself.

trans-unit.source: Dtu
trans-unit.target: Dtu

trans-unit.source: Number of eDTUs shared by all databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: Number of eDTUs shared by all databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: edition
trans-unit.target: edition

trans-unit.source: Service tier of the pool.
trans-unit.target: Service tier of the pool.

trans-unit.source: Every database within the pool has this edition.
trans-unit.target: Every database within the pool has this edition.

trans-unit.source: elasticPoolId
trans-unit.target: elasticPoolId

trans-unit.source: GUID of the instance of the pool.
trans-unit.target: GUID of the instance of the pool.

trans-unit.source: elasticPoolName
trans-unit.target: elasticPoolName

trans-unit.source: Name of the pool.
trans-unit.target: Name of the pool.

trans-unit.source: The name is unique relative to its parent server.
trans-unit.target: The name is unique relative to its parent server.

trans-unit.source: location
trans-unit.target: location

trans-unit.source: Data center location where the pool was created.
trans-unit.target: Data center location where the pool was created.

trans-unit.source: state
trans-unit.target: state

trans-unit.source: State is “Disabled” if payment of the bill for subscription is delinquent, and “Ready” otherwise.
trans-unit.target: State is “Disabled” if payment of the bill for subscription is delinquent, and “Ready” otherwise.

trans-unit.source: storageMB
trans-unit.target: storageMB

trans-unit.source: Storage limit in MB for the pool.
trans-unit.target: Storage limit in MB for the pool.

trans-unit.source: Any single database in the pool can use up to Standard Edition storage limit (250 GB), but the total of storage used by all databases in the pool cannot exceed this pool limit.
trans-unit.target: Any single database in the pool can use up to Standard Edition storage limit (250 GB), but the total of storage used by all databases in the pool cannot exceed this pool limit.

trans-unit.source: The storage limit of the pool is determined by the amount of eDTUs of the pool.
trans-unit.target: The storage limit of the pool is determined by the amount of eDTUs of the pool.

trans-unit.source: property
trans-unit.target: property

trans-unit.source: Basic
trans-unit.target: Basic

trans-unit.source: Standard
trans-unit.target: Standard

trans-unit.source: Premium
trans-unit.target: Premium

trans-unit.source: dtu
trans-unit.target: dtu

trans-unit.source: databaseDtuMax
trans-unit.target: databaseDtuMax

trans-unit.source: 5
trans-unit.target: 5

trans-unit.source: 10, 20, 50, 100
trans-unit.target: 10, 20, 50, 100

trans-unit.source: databaseDtuMin
trans-unit.target: databaseDtuMin

trans-unit.source: 0, 5
trans-unit.target: 0, 5

trans-unit.source: storageMB*
trans-unit.target: storageMB*

trans-unit.source: 100 GB, 200 GB, 400 GB, 800 GB, 1200 GB
trans-unit.target: 100 GB, 200 GB, 400 GB, 800 GB, 1200 GB

trans-unit.source: 62.5 GB, 125 GB, 250 GB, 500 GB, 750 GB
trans-unit.target: 62.5 GB, 125 GB, 250 GB, 500 GB, 750 GB

trans-unit.source: storage per DTU
trans-unit.target: storage per DTU

trans-unit.source: 100 MB
trans-unit.target: 100 MB

trans-unit.source: 1 GB
trans-unit.target: 1 GB

trans-unit.source: .5 GB
trans-unit.target: .5 GB

trans-unit.source: max databases per pool
trans-unit.target: max databases per pool

trans-unit.source: Default values are bold.
trans-unit.target: Default values are bold.

trans-unit.source: *units in API are MB, not GB.
trans-unit.target: *units in API are MB, not GB.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of concurrent workers and concurrent sessions supported for all databases in an elastic pool depends on the eDTU setting for the pool:
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of concurrent workers and concurrent sessions supported for all databases in an elastic pool depends on the eDTU setting for the pool:

trans-unit.source: eDTUs
trans-unit.target: eDTUs

trans-unit.source: Max concurrent workers
trans-unit.target: Max concurrent workers

trans-unit.source: Max concurrent sessions
trans-unit.target: Max concurrent sessions

trans-unit.source: 100 (Basic/Standard), 125 (Premium)
trans-unit.target: 100 (Basic/Standard), 125 (Premium)

trans-unit.source: 200 (Basic/Standard), 250 (Premium)
trans-unit.target: 200 (Basic/Standard), 250 (Premium)

trans-unit.source: 400 (Basic/Standard), 500 (Premium)
trans-unit.target: 400 (Basic/Standard), 500 (Premium)

trans-unit.source: 800 (Basic/Standard), 1,000 (Premium)
trans-unit.target: 800 (Basic/Standard), 1,000 (Premium)

trans-unit.source: 1,200 (Basic/Standard), 1,500 (Premium)
trans-unit.target: 1,200 (Basic/Standard), 1,500 (Premium)

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database V12 servers are located in resource groups.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database V12 servers are located in resource groups.

trans-unit.source: Each resource group can have a maximum 800 servers.
trans-unit.target: Each resource group can have a maximum 800 servers.

trans-unit.source: Each server can have a maximum 800 elastic pools.
trans-unit.target: Each server can have a maximum 800 elastic pools.

trans-unit.source: Changing the guaranteed eDTUs per database (databaseDtuMin) or maximum eDTUs per database (databaseDtuMax) typically completes in 5 minutes or less.
trans-unit.target: Changing the guaranteed eDTUs per database (databaseDtuMin) or maximum eDTUs per database (databaseDtuMax) typically completes in 5 minutes or less.

trans-unit.source: Changing the eDTU / storage limit (storageMB) of the pool depends on the total amount of space used by all databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: Changing the eDTU / storage limit (storageMB) of the pool depends on the total amount of space used by all databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: Changes average 90 minutes or less per 100 GB.
trans-unit.target: Changes average 90 minutes or less per 100 GB.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the total space used by all databases in the pool is 200 GB, then the expected latency for changing the pool eDTU / storage limit is 3 hours or less.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the total space used by all databases in the pool is 200 GB, then the expected latency for changing the pool eDTU / storage limit is 3 hours or less.

trans-unit.source: Several PowerShell cmdlets and REST API commands are available for creating and managing elastic pools.
trans-unit.target: Several PowerShell cmdlets and REST API commands are available for creating and managing elastic pools.

trans-unit.source: For details and code examples, see <linkText>Create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>Create and manage SQL Database with C#</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details and code examples, see <linkText>Create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>Create and manage SQL Database with C#</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: You can use Transact-SQL to do the following elastic database management tasks:

trans-unit.source: Task
trans-unit.target: Task

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.target: Create a new elastic database (directly in a pool)

trans-unit.target: <linkText>CREATE DATABASE (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Move existing databases in and out of a pool

trans-unit.target: <linkText>ALTER DATABASE (Transact-SQL)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Get a pool's resource usage statistics
trans-unit.target: Get a pool's resource usage statistics

trans-unit.source: [sys.elasticpoolresource_stats (Azure SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt280062.aspx)
trans-unit.target: [sys.elasticpoolresource_stats (Azure SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt280062.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Elastic database pools are billed per the following characteristics:
trans-unit.target: Elastic database pools are billed per the following characteristics:

trans-unit.source: An elastic pool is billed upon its creation, even when there are no databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: An elastic pool is billed upon its creation, even when there are no databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: An elastic pool is billed hourly.
trans-unit.target: An elastic pool is billed hourly.

trans-unit.source: This is the same metering frequency as for performance levels of standalone databases.
trans-unit.target: This is the same metering frequency as for performance levels of standalone databases.

trans-unit.source: If an elastic pool is resized to a new amount of eDTUs, then the pool is not billed according to the new amount of eDTUS until the resizing operation completes.
trans-unit.target: If an elastic pool is resized to a new amount of eDTUs, then the pool is not billed according to the new amount of eDTUS until the resizing operation completes.

trans-unit.source: This follows the same pattern as changing the performance level of standalone databases.
trans-unit.target: This follows the same pattern as changing the performance level of standalone databases.

trans-unit.source: The price of an elastic pool is based on the number of eDTUs of the pool, and the number of databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The price of an elastic pool is based on the number of eDTUs of the pool, and the number of databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: The price of an elastic pool is independent of the utilization of the elastic databases within it.
trans-unit.target: The price of an elastic pool is independent of the utilization of the elastic databases within it.

trans-unit.source: Price is computed by (number of pool eDTUs)x(unit price per eDTU) + (number of databases)x(unit price per database)
trans-unit.target: Price is computed by (number of pool eDTUs)x(unit price per eDTU) + (number of databases)x(unit price per database)

trans-unit.source: The unit eDTU price for an elastic pool is higher than the unit DTU price for a standalone database in the same service tier.
trans-unit.target: The unit eDTU price for an elastic pool is higher than the unit DTU price for a standalone database in the same service tier.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <linkText>SQL Database pricing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <linkText>SQL Database pricing</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: EX_RESOURCE
trans-unit.target: EX_RESOURCE

trans-unit.source: The elastic pool has reached its storage limit.
trans-unit.target: The elastic pool has reached its storage limit.

trans-unit.source: The storage usage for the elastic pool cannot exceed (%d) MBs.
trans-unit.target: The storage usage for the elastic pool cannot exceed (%d) MBs.

trans-unit.source: Elastic pool space limit in MBs.
trans-unit.target: Elastic pool space limit in MBs.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to write data to a database when the storage limit of the elastic pool has been reached.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to write data to a database when the storage limit of the elastic pool has been reached.

trans-unit.source: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool if possible in order to increase its storage limit, reduce the storage used by individual databases within the elastic pool, or remove databases from the elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool if possible in order to increase its storage limit, reduce the storage used by individual databases within the elastic pool, or remove databases from the elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: EX_USER
trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.target: The %s minimum guarantee is %d, maximum limit is %d and the current usage for the database is %d.

trans-unit.source: However, the server is currently too busy to support requests greater than %d for this database.
trans-unit.target: However, the server is currently too busy to support requests greater than %d for this database.

trans-unit.target: See <linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=267637</linkText><title></title> for assistance.

trans-unit.target: Otherwise, please try again later.

trans-unit.target: DTU min per database; DTU max per database

trans-unit.source: The total number of concurrent workers (requests) across all databases in the elastic pool attempted to exceed the pool limit.
trans-unit.target: The total number of concurrent workers (requests) across all databases in the elastic pool attempted to exceed the pool limit.

trans-unit.source: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool if possible in order to increase its worker limit, or remove databases from the elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool if possible in order to increase its worker limit, or remove databases from the elastic pool.

trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: Elastic pool and service objective can be specified together only if service objective is specified as 'ElasticPool'.
trans-unit.target: Elastic pool and service objective can be specified together only if service objective is specified as 'ElasticPool'.

trans-unit.source: Please specify correct combination of elastic pool and service objective.
trans-unit.target: Please specify correct combination of elastic pool and service objective.

trans-unit.source: The database edition '%.ls' cannot be different than the elastic pool service tier which is '%.ls'.
trans-unit.target: The database edition '%.ls' cannot be different than the elastic pool service tier which is '%.ls'.

trans-unit.source: database edition, elastic pool service tier
trans-unit.target: database edition, elastic pool service tier

trans-unit.source: The database edition is different than the elastic pool service tier.
trans-unit.target: The database edition is different than the elastic pool service tier.

trans-unit.source: Please do not specify a database edition which is different than the elastic pool service tier.
trans-unit.target: Please do not specify a database edition which is different than the elastic pool service tier.

trans-unit.source: Note that the database edition does not need to be specified.
trans-unit.target: Note that the database edition does not need to be specified.

trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: Elastic pool name must be specified if the elastic pool service objective is specified.
trans-unit.target: Elastic pool name must be specified if the elastic pool service objective is specified.

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Elastic pool service objective does not uniquely identify an elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Elastic pool service objective does not uniquely identify an elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: Please specify the elastic pool name if using the elastic pool service objective.
trans-unit.target: Please specify the elastic pool name if using the elastic pool service objective.

trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: The DTUs for the elastic pool must be at least (%d) DTUs for service tier '%.*ls'.
trans-unit.target: The DTUs for the elastic pool must be at least (%d) DTUs for service tier '%.*ls'.

trans-unit.source: DTUs for elastic pool; elastic pool service tier.
trans-unit.target: DTUs for elastic pool; elastic pool service tier.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to set the DTUs for the elastic pool below the minimum limit.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to set the DTUs for the elastic pool below the minimum limit.

trans-unit.source: Please retry setting the DTUs for the elastic pool to at least the minimum limit.
trans-unit.target: Please retry setting the DTUs for the elastic pool to at least the minimum limit.

trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: The DTUs for the elastic pool cannot exceed (%d) DTUs for service tier '%.*ls'.
trans-unit.target: The DTUs for the elastic pool cannot exceed (%d) DTUs for service tier '%.*ls'.

trans-unit.target: DTUs for elastic pool; elastic pool service tier.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to set the DTUs for the elastic pool above the maximum limit.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to set the DTUs for the elastic pool above the maximum limit.

trans-unit.source: Please retry setting the DTUs for the elastic pool to no greater than the maximum limit.
trans-unit.target: Please retry setting the DTUs for the elastic pool to no greater than the maximum limit.

trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.target: The DTU max per database must be at least (%d) for service tier '%.*ls'.

trans-unit.target: DTU max per database; elastic pool service tier

trans-unit.target: Attempting to set the DTU max per database below the supported limit.

trans-unit.source: Please consider using the elastic pool service tier that supports the desired setting.
trans-unit.target: Please consider using the elastic pool service tier that supports the desired setting.

trans-unit.target: DTU min per database; elastic pool service tier.

trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: The number of databases (%d) and DTU min per database (%d) cannot exceed the DTUs of the elastic pool (%d).
trans-unit.target: The number of databases (%d) and DTU min per database (%d) cannot exceed the DTUs of the elastic pool (%d).

trans-unit.source: Number databases in elastic pool; DTU min per database; DTUs of elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Number databases in elastic pool; DTU min per database; DTUs of elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to specify DTU min for databases in the elastic pool that exceeds the DTUs of the elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to specify DTU min for databases in the elastic pool that exceeds the DTUs of the elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool, or decrease the DTU min per database, or decrease the number of databases in the elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool, or decrease the DTU min per database, or decrease the number of databases in the elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: EX_USER
trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: An elastic pool cannot be deleted unless it does not contain any databases.
trans-unit.target: An elastic pool cannot be deleted unless it does not contain any databases.

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: The elastic pool contains one or more databases and therefore cannot be deleted.
trans-unit.target: The elastic pool contains one or more databases and therefore cannot be deleted.

trans-unit.source: Please remove databases from the elastic pool in order to delete it.
trans-unit.target: Please remove databases from the elastic pool in order to delete it.

trans-unit.source: EX_USER
trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: The elastic pool '%.*ls' has reached its database count limit.
trans-unit.target: The elastic pool '%.*ls' has reached its database count limit.

trans-unit.source: The database count limit for the elastic pool cannot exceed (%d) for an elastic pool with (%d) DTUs.
trans-unit.target: The database count limit for the elastic pool cannot exceed (%d) for an elastic pool with (%d) DTUs.

trans-unit.source: Name of elastic pool; database count limit of elastic pool;e DTUs for resource pool.
trans-unit.target: Name of elastic pool; database count limit of elastic pool;e DTUs for resource pool.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to create or add database to elastic pool when the database count limit of the elastic pool has been reached.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to create or add database to elastic pool when the database count limit of the elastic pool has been reached.

trans-unit.source: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool if possible in order to increase its database limit, or remove databases from the elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Please consider increasing the DTUs of the elastic pool if possible in order to increase its database limit, or remove databases from the elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: EX_USER
trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: The DTUs or storage limit for the elastic pool '%.*ls' cannot be decreased since that would not provide sufficient storage space for its databases.
trans-unit.target: The DTUs or storage limit for the elastic pool '%.*ls' cannot be decreased since that would not provide sufficient storage space for its databases.

trans-unit.source: Name of elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Name of elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to decrease the storage limit of the elastic pool below its storage usage.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to decrease the storage limit of the elastic pool below its storage usage.

trans-unit.source: Please consider reducing the storage usage of individual databases in the elastic pool or remove databases from the pool in order to reduce its DTUs or storage limit.
trans-unit.target: Please consider reducing the storage usage of individual databases in the elastic pool or remove databases from the pool in order to reduce its DTUs or storage limit.

trans-unit.source: EX_USER
trans-unit.target: EX_USER

trans-unit.source: The DTU min per database (%d) cannot exceed the DTU max per database (%d).
trans-unit.target: The DTU min per database (%d) cannot exceed the DTU max per database (%d).

trans-unit.source: DTU min per database; DTU max per database.
trans-unit.target: DTU min per database; DTU max per database.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to set the DTU min per database higher than the DTU max per database.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to set the DTU min per database higher than the DTU max per database.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure the DTU min per databases does not exceed the DTU max per database.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure the DTU min per databases does not exceed the DTU max per database.

trans-unit.source: The storage size for an individual database in a elastic pool cannot exceed the max size allowed by '%.*ls' service tier elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: The storage size for an individual database in a elastic pool cannot exceed the max size allowed by '%.*ls' service tier elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: elastic pool service tier
trans-unit.target: elastic pool service tier

trans-unit.source: The max size for the database exceeds the max size allowed by the elastic pool service tier.
trans-unit.target: The max size for the database exceeds the max size allowed by the elastic pool service tier.

trans-unit.source: Please set the max size of the database within the limits of the max size allowed by the elastic pool service tier.
trans-unit.target: Please set the max size of the database within the limits of the max size allowed by the elastic pool service tier.
